services.title: SERVICES:
services.subtitle: From routine care to complex surgical procedures, we offer a full range of urological treatments using the latest technologies and methods.

items.title: KIDNEY STONE TREATMENT
items.preview: Effective treatment of kidney stone disease using the latest technologies and minimally invasive techniques.
items.description: With an individual approach to each patient, taking into account the size and type of stone, kidney function and comorbidities - we develop optimal treatment tactics in each specific case:

procedures.name: Contact ureterolithotripsy and nephrolithotripsy
procedures.description: endoscopic crushing and removal of stones through natural pathways

procedures.name: Percutaneous Nephrolithotomy (PCNL)
procedures.description: minimally traumatic removal of large or complex stones through a small puncture in the lower back

procedures.name: Extracorporeal Shock Wave Lithotripsy (ESWL)
procedures.description: non-operative stone fragmentation with ultrasound waves

items.title: LAPAROSCOPIC SURGERY
items.preview: High-precision and minimally traumatic method of treating pathologies of the kidneys, adrenal glands, ureters, bladder and prostate gland
items.description: Provides high accuracy, minimal trauma and rapid recovery

procedures.name: Laparoscopic kidney surgery:
procedures.description: Laparoscopic nephrectomy (kidney removal); partial nephrectomy (resection of the kidney); nephroureterectomy; pyeloplasty; nephropexy; renal cystectomy

procedures.name: Laparoscopic adrenal surgery:
procedures.description: Laparoscopic adrenalectomy (removal of one or both adrenal glands);

procedures.name: Laparoscopic Ureteral Surgery:
procedures.description: Laparoscopic Ureterolysis; Ureteroneoanastomosis; Ureteral Reimplantation into the Bladder;

procedures.name: Laparoscopic Bladder Surgery:
procedures.description: Laparoscopic cystectomy; laparoscopic bladder reconstruction; bladder diverticulum removal

procedures.name: Other laparoscopic urological procedures:
procedures.description: Laparoscopic lymphadenectomy; Laparoscopic transposition of vessels for compression syndromes; Laparoscopic varicocelectomy (through the peritoneum)

kidney-stone-treatment.title: Urolithiasis Treatment
subtitle: Urolithiasis is one of the most common urological diseases, arising from the formation of stones (calculi) in the kidneys, ureters, or bladder.

diagnostics.title: Diagnostics:
methods: Ultrasound examination (US) of the urinary system organs
Computed tomography (CT) of kidneys and ureters
Laboratory analysis of urine, blood
X-ray examination (when indicated)
Radiological examination methods
Angiography
diagnostics.description: Diagnostics allows determining the size, location, and composition of the stone, which is crucial for choosing the optimal treatment approach.

treatment.title: Treatment:
treatment.intro: We offer an individual approach to each patient, considering the size and type of stone, renal function status, and comorbidities.
treatment.subtitle: Our department performs:

methods.name: Contact ureterolithotripsy and nephrolithotripsy
methods.description: endoscopic stone fragmentation and removal through natural pathways

methods.name: Percutaneous nephrolithotomy (PCNL)
methods.description: minimally invasive removal of large or complex stones through a small incision in the lower back

methods.name: Extracorporeal Shock Wave Lithotripsy (ESWL)
methods.description: non-surgical stone fragmentation using ultrasound waves

treatment.aftercare: After treatment, metabolic examination is conducted to prevent stone recurrence.

prevention.title: Prevention:
methods: rational nutrition for those prone to stone formation,
optimal drinking regimen,
control of salt levels and metabolism.
prevention.description: Regular follow-up with a urologist helps avoid recurrence and maintain kidney health.

consultation.title: Consultation:
consultation.description: Our doctors have extensive experience in treating urolithiasis of any complexity. By contacting us, you will receive an accurate diagnosis, modern treatment and care for your health.

laparoscopic-surgery.title: Laparoscopic Surgery
subtitle: Laparoscopic operations are minimally invasive surgical interventions performed through several small punctures (5–10 mm) in the abdominal wall using special instruments and a video camera (laparoscope). The image of internal organs is transmitted to a monitor, allowing the surgeon to perform the operation without a large incision.

diagnostics.title: Advantages of laparoscopic operations over open ones:
methods: 1. Less traumatic — instead of a large incision - small punctures.
2. Less blood loss.
3. Less postoperative pain.
4. Faster recovery and shorter hospital stay.
5. Better cosmetic effect (small scars).
6. Lower risk of postoperative complications (infections, adhesions, hernias).
7. More precise visualization of organs — thanks to image magnification on screen.

treatment.title: Laparoscopic operations in urology:
description: Urology is one of the most active fields in the use of laparoscopy.

Laparoscopic urological surgery is a minimally invasive method of treating pathologies of the kidneys, adrenal glands, ureters, bladder and prostate, which ensures high precision, minimal invasiveness and rapid recovery.
Here is a complete list of main laparoscopic interventions in modern urological practice:
methods: **1. On the kidneys:**</br>*Laparoscopic nephrectomy* — kidney removal.</br>*Essence:* complete removal of the kidney along with surrounding adipose tissue.</br>*Indications:* kidney cancer (T1–T2), nephrosclerosis, purulent-destructive pyelonephritis, kidney atrophy.</br>*Procedure:* through 3–4 punctures in the abdominal wall, the kidney is isolated, vessels are clipped, ureter is cut, and the organ is removed in a special container.</br>*Advantages:* less blood loss, short hospitalization (3–5 days), rapid recovery.</br></br>*Laparoscopic partial nephrectomy (kidney resection)* — tumor removal with organ preservation.</br>*Essence:* removal of only the kidney tumor with part of the parenchyma, preservation of the rest of the organ.</br>*Indications:* tumors up to 4 cm (T1a), solitary kidney, bilateral tumors.</br>*Procedure:* temporary clamping of kidney vessels, tumor excision, parenchyma suturing.</br>*Advantages:* preservation of kidney function, minimal invasiveness.</br></br>*Laparoscopic nephroureterectomy* — removal of kidney together with ureter (for cancer of the pelvic-ureteral segment).</br>*Essence:* removal of kidney together with ureter and part of bladder wall.</br>*Indications:* transitional cell carcinoma of pelvic-ureteral segment.</br>*Feature:* requires careful work near the bladder, often combined with laparoscopic cystectomy.</br></br>*Laparoscopic pyeloplasty* — reconstruction of pelvic-ureteral segment in stenosis.</br>*Essence:* reconstruction of pelvic-ureteral segment in stenosis.</br>*Indications:* congenital or acquired stenosis (hydronephrosis).</br>*Procedure:* narrowed area is removed, new connection between pelvis and ureter (anastomosis) is formed, stent is placed.</br>*Advantages:* high success rate (over 90%), minimal scarring.</br></br>*Laparoscopic nephropexy* — fixation of prolapsed kidney.</br>*Essence:* fixation of mobile (prolapsed) kidney to lumbar fascia or muscles.</br>*Indications:* nephroptosis (kidney prolapse) with pain syndrome.</br>*Procedure:* kidney is mobilized and sutured to fixing structures.</br>*Advantages:* rapid recovery, effective pain relief.</br></br>*Laparoscopic kidney cystectomy* — excision or treatment of cyst.</br>*Essence:* excision of cyst wall and drainage of its cavity.</br>*Indications:* symptomatic cyst larger than 5 cm, infected cyst.</br>*Procedure:* through punctures, cyst is opened, wall is removed, residual surface is coagulated.</br>*Advantages:* short operation, low recurrence risk.

**2. On the adrenal glands:**</br>*Laparoscopic adrenalectomy* — removal of one or both adrenal glands (for adenomas, pheochromocytoma, corticosteroma, etc.).</br>*Essence:* removal of one or both adrenal glands.</br>*Indications:* hormonally active tumors (pheochromocytoma, corticosteroma, aldosteroma), non-functioning adenomas >4 cm.</br>*Procedure:* through 3–4 punctures, adrenal gland is isolated, vessels are clipped, organ is removed.</br>*Advantages:* minimal bleeding risk, rapid restoration of hormonal balance.

**3. On the ureters:**</br>*Laparoscopic ureterolysis* — release of ureter from fibrous or adhesive fusions.</br>*Essence:* release of ureter from adhesions, fibrosis, or vascular compression.</br>*Indications:* secondary ureteral strictures, retroperitoneal fibrosis (Ormond's syndrome).</br>*Advantages:* restoration of urine passage without open access.</br></br>*Laparoscopic ureteroneoanastomosis* — ureter reconstruction after damage or stricture.</br>*Essence:* removal of damaged part of ureter and creation of new connection between its ends.</br>*Indications:* trauma, tumors, scar narrowing.</br>*Advantages:* restoration of ureter integrity, organ preservation.</br></br>*Ureter reimplantation into bladder* — ureterocystoanastomosis (laparoscopic technique).</br>*Essence:* transplantation of distal ureter end to new location on bladder wall.</br>*Indications:* reflux, damage during gynecological or oncological operations.</br>*Advantages:* restoration of urine outflow, hydronephrosis prevention.

**4. On the bladder:**</br>*Laparoscopic cystectomy* — bladder removal (complete or partial).</br>*Essence:* complete or partial bladder removal for cancer.</br>*Indications:* invasive bladder cancer, multiple tumors.</br>*Options:*</br>*Radical:* bladder, prostate (in men) or uterus (in women), lymph nodes are removed.</br>*Partial:* for localized tumors.</br>*Advantages:* fewer complications, possibility of neobladder creation.</br></br>*Laparoscopic bladder reconstruction (neocystis creation from intestine)*.</br>*Essence:* creation of new bladder from intestinal fragment.</br>*Indications:* after radical cystectomy.</br>*Advantages:* patient retains natural urination, no external bag.</br></br>*Laparoscopic removal of bladder diverticula.*</br>*Essence:* excision of bladder wall protrusions.</br>*Indications:* large diverticula, urine stasis, infections.</br>*Advantages:* restoration of normal urine drainage.

**5. On the prostate:**</br>*Laparoscopic radical prostatectomy* — prostate removal for most prostate cancers.</br>*Essence:* complete removal of prostate along with seminal vesicles.</br>*Indications:* prostate cancer stage T1–T2.</br>*Procedure:* preservation of neurovascular bundles when possible.</br>*Advantages:* less blood loss, urinary control is preserved.</br></br>*Laparoscopic adenomectomy* — prostate adenoma removal for benign hyperplasia (alternative to open).</br>*Essence:* removal of hyperplastic tissue for large prostate adenoma (>80 ml).</br>*Indications:* benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH).</br>*Advantages:* alternative to open prostatectomy, fewer complications.

**6. Other laparoscopic urological interventions:**</br>*Laparoscopic lymphadenectomy* — lymph node removal (for oncological diseases).</br>*Essence:* removal of pelvic or retroperitoneal lymph nodes.</br>*Indications:* staging or treatment of kidney, prostate, testicular cancer.</br></br>*Laparoscopic vascular transposition for compression syndromes* — (e.g., nutcracker syndrome).</br>*Essence:* repositioning of vessels compressing the ureter (nutcracker syndrome, May-Thurner syndrome).</br>*Indications:* compression syndromes.</br>*Advantages:* restoration of normal blood or urine outflow.</br></br>*Laparoscopic varicocelectomy (transperitoneal)* — varicocele treatment (less common, more often performed microsurgically).</br>*Essence:* ligation of internal testicular veins.</br>*Indications:* varicocele, infertility, scrotal pain.</br>*Advantages:* short operation, fertility restoration.
**Laparoscopic ligation of internal iliac vessels for bleeding or oncological operations.**

reproductive-surgery.title: REPRODUCTIVE ORGAN SURGERIES
subtitle: Urology is not only about complex operations and long-term treatment.
Today, many male and female health problems can be solved quickly, painlessly and without the need for hospitalization.
Our department performs a wide range of quick, minimally invasive procedures that significantly improve quality of life.
After them, the patient can usually return home the same day.
Such interventions are aimed at eliminating functional or aesthetic problems, improving hygiene and preventing complications in the future.
In particular, doctors of our department perform procedures that will help you get rid of such problems as:

methods: *Phimosis* – narrowing of the foreskin (treatment – circumcision);
*Small skin or mucosal growths* (papillomas, condylomas, etc.);
*Short penile frenulum;*
*Spermatic cord or scrotal cyst;*
*Hydrocele* (testicular dropsy);
description: *How does the procedure work?*
1. Consultation with a urologist, during which the need for intervention is determined.
2. Tests and examinations (if needed).
3. The operation itself.
4. Observation after the procedure and discharge.
5. Follow-up examination in a few days.

treatment.title: Frequently Asked Questions:
description: *Is it painful?*</br>No. Local anesthesia or general anesthesia is used – you do not feel pain during the intervention.
*Do scars remain?*</br>Scars after minor surgery are usually inconspicuous or minimal.
*Do I need to prepare for the procedure?*</br>The doctor will provide clear individual recommendations before the intervention.
methods: **1. Circumcision: when it's needed, how it works, what to expect:**</br>Circumcision is the surgical removal of the foreskin (the skin fold covering the glans of the penis).</br>This is one of the most common and safe urological procedures, which can be performed for medical, hygienic or cultural reasons.</br>*Main indications for circumcision:*</br>-Phimosis – narrowing of the foreskin that prevents full opening of the penis glans</br>-Paraphimosis – pinching of the foreskin behind the glans (emergency condition);</br>-Chronic inflammation (balanoposthitis) that does not respond to medical treatment;</br>-Prevention of urogenital infections (especially with frequent recurrences);</br>-Hygienic or religious considerations;</br>-Problems during sexual life due to short frenulum or phimosis</br></br>*What types of circumcision exist?*</br>Depending on tissue condition, patient age and preferences, the doctor may suggest one of the operation variants:</br>*1. Complete circumcision*</br>All foreskin is removed, glans remains fully exposed. Most commonly used for phimosis.</br>*2. Partial circumcision*</br>Only part of the foreskin is removed, glans remains partially covered. Used less often, mainly for aesthetic reasons.</br>*3. Classic surgical technique (scalpel)*</br>Performed using scalpel or scissors under local anesthesia. Most common method.</br>*4. Circumcision using radiowave knife*</br>Modern, minimally traumatic technique. Less bleeding, less swelling, faster healing.</br>*5. Circumcision with or without sutures*</br>In some cases, special techniques are used that do not require sutures (for example, using a clamp or ring in children)</br></br>*Benefits of circumcision:*</br>-Improved hygiene</br>-Reduced risk of infections</br>-Facilitation of sexual life (with phimosis, short frenulum)</br>-Prevention of certain diseases (for example, reduced risk of HPV and HIV in some studies)</br>-Aesthetic effect (upon patient request)</br></br>*Recovery after surgery*</br>-First 1–3 days – possible swelling, slight discomfort</br>-Painkillers and antiseptic agents are prescribed</br>-Hygiene – daily treatments as recommended by doctor</br>-Suture removal (if not self-dissolving) – usually on day 7–10</br>-Return to sexual life – approximately after 3–4 weeks</br></br>*Frequently asked questions:*</br>*At what age is it better to do circumcision?*</br>The procedure can be performed in both childhood and adulthood. In adults – more often for medical reasons.</br></br>*Does circumcision affect sexual life?*</br>Yes, but usually positively – discomfort and pain decrease, confidence increases. Sensitivity may change slightly, but this usually does not reduce the quality of sexual life.

**2. Removal of condylomas and papillomas:**</br>Condylomas and papillomas are benign growths that appear as a result of viral infection. They can cause discomfort and psychological stress.</br>Removal of such growths is carried out using modern technologies – laser or radiowave method. The procedure is safe, painless and leaves no noticeable traces.

**3. Penile plastic surgery:**</br>Plastic surgery is performed for curvature, trauma consequences or aesthetic indications.</br>Modern methods allow correcting shape, restoring symmetry and improving the appearance of the penis while preserving all its natural functions.</br>Such operations help not only physically but also psychologically – returning confidence to a man, and in complex cases, allowing a return to comfortable and quality sexual life.

**4. Treatment of testicular hydrocele (hydrocele)**</br>Testicular hydrocele is an accumulation of fluid in the testicular membranes, causing the scrotum to increase in size, with possible feelings of heaviness or discomfort.</br>Modern minor surgery allows safe removal of hydrocele, restoring normal appearance and well-being. After the intervention, the patient recovers quickly and returns to normal life within a few days.

**5. Testicular prosthetics**</br>In case of testicular absence (after trauma, surgery or congenital defects), installation of a special prosthesis is possible.</br>This procedure is mainly aesthetic in nature and helps restore scrotal symmetry.
advantages: Want to learn more or schedule a procedure? - Fill out the form below - and we will contact you for a consultation
Trust your health to an experienced urologist.

robotic-surgery.title: ROBOTIC SURGERY
robotic-surgery.subtitle: The most advanced robotic systems for maximum surgical precision.

methods: Robotic surgery allows doctors to perform many types of complex procedures with greater precision and control than is possible with traditional procedures.
Such surgery is often performed through tiny incisions. But sometimes it is also used in open operations.
</br></br>Typically, a robotic surgery system includes an arm with a camera and mechanical arms with surgical instruments attached to them.

The surgeon necessarily controls the robot's arms while sitting at a console near the operating table. And thanks to the high clarity and 3D projection of the area where the surgical intervention is performed, the surgeon sees a clear and magnified intervention area.
</br></br>In our work, we use the da Vinci Surgical System robot.

treatment.title: What is the da Vinci robot and how is it used:
description: The da Vinci surgical robot is an alternative surgical method to laparoscopic procedures and is gaining increasing popularity among hospitals around the world since it was officially approved by the FDA (Food and Drug Administration - whose certification is considered a key global quality standard) in America in 2000.
</br></br>The robot is designed for minimally invasive surgery in procedures including urological, laparoscopic and other surgical procedures.
Some examples of urological diseases in which the robot can be chosen instead of an alternative procedure, laparoscopic surgery, include:
methods: - *Kidney disorders* (kidney stones; acute kidney injury; pyelonephritis; chronic kidney disease; glomerulonephritis and others);
- *Prostate hyperplasia*;
- *Kidney cancer*;
advantages: - Less likelihood of pain and blood loss.
- Shorter hospital stay and faster recovery.

methods: Like any surgical intervention, robotic surgery is associated with risks similar to those of traditional open surgery, such as a small risk of infection or other complications.

Therefore, to determine whether robotic surgery is right for you, you will receive a consultation from our doctor about the benefits and risks of robotic surgery and which treatment method is best to choose in your particular case.

mens-and-womens-health.title: MEN'S AND WOMEN'S HEALTH
subtitle: Urological problems could affect both men and women. Our doctors provide a delicate and professional approach to each patient — regardless of the nature of the deceases.

methods: If you experience urination disorders, unexplained pelvic pain, urinary urgency or its absence, urinary retention after strokes, spinal injuries or gynecological surgeries, unsatisfactory results from treatment at various clinics, problems with urine flow after prostate surgery — these and many other issues can be resolved after a comprehensive urodynamic study.
Using expert-level PICO SMART equipment (Medica, Italy), Ukraine's leading specialists Mykhailov D.M. and Melymuka O.V. will perform filling cystometry or pressure-flow studies.
The procedure is helpful not only for adults, but also for children.
Examinations are performed promptly, on an outpatient basis and do not require general anesthesia.
description: *Treatment of urinary incontinence of all types and any complexity:*
Our department's doctors are able to identify all the details regarding the causes of the condition using the most advanced urodynamic equipment.
For women and men with stress urinary incontinence of any age, we offer original sling systems from the world's leading manufacturers. Maximum effectiveness with no issues of erosion or infection.
*Treatment of chronic pain syndrome and overactive bladder:*

Unique treatment methods for chronic bladder pain and overactive bladder have been used for many years. Thanks to the widespread use of botulinum therapy in treating various urogynecological problems (injections into the bladder wall, submucosa, perineal muscles and other trigger points) using exclusively the original Botox product (Allergan, Ireland), impressive results have been achieved with complete safety.
Currently, the intravesical botox injection technique is successfully applied to men simultaneously with transurethral operations for prostate hyperplasia.
*Treatment of urinary tract infections:*
Urinary tract infections are one of the most common conditions, which may present with frequent painful urination, a feeling of incomplete bladder emptying, and discomfort in the lower abdomen.
With timely treatment, therapy is generally short and effective.

Recurrent forms require special attention — when flare-ups occur three or more times per year. In such cases, we conduct in-depth diagnostics to identify the cause of recurrences and develop an individual preventive treatment plan.

treatment.title: In addition, we also treat the following urological conditions:
methods: **For men:**</br> - Prostatitis treatment and benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH) (/services/hyperplasia-treatment).</br> - Diseases of the urethra and bladder.</br> - Other sensitive problems.
**For women:**</br> - Cystitis and recurrent urinary tract infections.</br> - Pelvic organ prolapse.</br> - Other sensitive problems.
advantages: Want to learn more or schedule a procedure? — Fill out the form below and we will contact you for a consultation.
Trust your health to an experienced urologist.

cancer-treatment.title: Oncourology
subtitle: Comprehensive diagnosis and treatment of malignant tumors of the genitourinary system.

hyperplasia-treatment.title: TREATMENT OF BENIGN PROSTATIC HYPERPLASIA:
subtitle: Treatment of benign prostatic hyperplasia (formerly prostate adenoma) includes several methods when conservative therapy is ineffective. Classical open surgery methods are rarely used at the current stage of medical technology development.

diagnostics.title: Transurethral Resection of the Prostate (TURP)
methods: - The current gold standard of surgical treatment is *transurethral resection of the prostate (TURP)*, meaning removal of prostate tissue through the urethra using stationary instruments.

This operation is the most widely performed in the world. First performed at the Mayo Clinic (USA) in 1939. Over nearly a century of use, significant technological advances have reduced postoperative complications and risks to fractions of a percent.

treatment.title: Treatment with Bipolar Plasmakinetic Prostate Resection:
description: - Our urology department has implemented and widely uses the method of *bipolar plasmakinetic prostate resection* using the most advanced equipment manufactured in Germany, Japan and the USA.
A distinctive feature of surgical care in our department is the ability to individually select the instrumental setup for each specific patient.
This applies to the anatomical characteristics of the urethra, previously performed procedures and surgical interventions on the urinary tract, and the volume of hypertrophied tissue.
The plasmakinetic resection method combined with vaporization in the surgical area ensures a shorter postoperative period of 2-3 days and rapid postoperative rehabilitation.
This distinguishes the technologies of our urology department from other urological institutions.

kidney-cancer-treatment.title: KIDNEY AND URETER CANCER TREATMENT
subtitle: Kidney and ureter cancer are serious oncourological diseases that require timely diagnosis and comprehensive treatment.

description: Modern diagnostics allows determining the disease stage, tumor size and location, presence of metastases, which is critical for choosing the optimal treatment approach.

treatment.title: Treatment Methods:
description: We offer an individual approach to each patient using the most advanced surgical and therapeutic methods.

methods.name: Radical nephrectomy
methods.description: complete removal of kidney with tumor for localized cancer

methods.name: Nephroureterectomy
methods.description: removal of kidney with ureter for upper urinary tract cancer

methods.name: Laparoscopic and robotic surgeries

advantages: Use of the most advanced protocols

bladder-cancer-treatment.title: BLADDER CANCER TREATMENT
subtitle: In our urology department, doctors effectively treat bladder tumors using modern methods.

treatment.title: Treatment Methods:
description: Superficial bladder cancer is a tumor that does not penetrate the muscular layer of the wall and is located on the mucous membrane. Transurethral resection of the bladder is used to treat this type of cancer.
During TUR, a biopsy of the bladder walls is also performed from areas around the tumor.
A distinctive feature of the operation is that there are no incisions on the patient's body:
- It is performed using a special instrument (resectoscope), which is inserted into the bladder through the urethra.
- A special optical device is inserted through the resectoscope into the bladder cavity, which displays images on a monitor screen.
- The tumor is removed using a loop at the end of the resectoscope, through which high-power electric current passes.

</br>For small tumors, specifically bladder tumors that do not extend beyond the bladder wall, they can be removed through the urethra without making any skin incisions – TUR. For such operations, the number of tumors or their size is not important; the effectiveness of operations largely depends on the surgeon's expertise.

</br>In terms of effectiveness, this operation has significant advantages. The short recovery period and minimal risk of postoperative complications make transurethral resection the 'gold standard' in the treatment of superficial bladder tumor processes.
advantages: No stitches or scars after surgery;
No contraindications for surgery even if the patient has comorbidities.

prostate-cancer-treatment.title: PROSTATE CANCER TREATMENT
subtitle: Prostate cancer is the most common oncourological disease in men. Timely diagnosis and properly chosen treatment provide high chances of recovery.

description: Comprehensive diagnostics allows determining disease stage, tumor aggressiveness and optimal treatment approach.

treatment.title: Treatment Methods:
description: Choice of treatment method depends on disease stage, patient age, comorbidities and individual characteristics.

methods.name: Laparoscopic and robotic prostatectomy
methods.description: minimally invasive operations with high precision and function preservation

advantages: Preservation of erectile function and urinary continence

prevention.title: Prevention and Early Detection:
methods: Annual PSA testing for men over 50
For men with family history — from age 45
Regular urological examinations
Healthy lifestyle and proper nutrition

fields: Treatment of inflammatory diseases of the genitourinary system (balanoposthitis, urethritis, prostatitis, orchoepididymitis, pyelonephritis);

Laparoscopic surgical interventions (radical prostatectomy; nephrectomy for cancer or hydronephrosis, kidney resection, pyeloureteral segment plastic surgery, renal cyst excision, varicocele excision, etc.);
Endoscopic surgical interventions (TUR of the prostate; TUR of the bladder; contact lithotripsy for SCH of the bladder, ureter, kidney; optical urethrotomy;

Open surgical urology (nephrectomy, prostatectomy; excision of varicocele (Marmara et al.); excision of epididymal cysts or hydrocele; frenulum plastic surgery; circumcision; excision of urethral polyp; removal of warts; correction of penile curvature, etc.);
Urgent urology (placement or replacement of urethral catheter, cystostomy, nephrostomy; ureteral stenting; percutaneous cystostomy; percutaneous nephrostomy);
Ultrasound diagnostics of kidneys, bladder, prostate;
